alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 9:55AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: .Hot temperatures have accelerated high elevation snowmelt. High flows will likely continue through the week before gradually receding this weekend. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT FRIDAY... ...REPLACES FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Inyo. * WHEN...Until 900 PM PDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 946 AM PDT, Automated gauge reports indicated rising water levels in creeks, streams and rivers from snowmelt. This will only exacerbate minor flooding that is already occurring in the advisory area. - This includes all creeks and streams from Rock Creek, south to Cottonwood Creek, as well as the Owens River. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Campgrounds, hiking trails and roads near waterways. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Minor flooding is occurring. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
